posts.name: David O'Regan
posts.cooked:
Language: Javascript

This prints

How would I go about getting the degrees from inside the Rotation2d?
You need to use .getDegrees() on the Rotation2d (at least in Java/C++ WPILib).

posts.name: Fletch
posts.cooked:
declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.math.geometry, class: Pose2d

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.math.geometry, class: Rotation2d

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: Is the actual value in NT a string?  If so, you’ll need to parse it.  But you’d be better off changing the sending code to put the value into an array of double.

posts.name: David O'Regan
posts.cooked: I am using Javascript for this, sorry for not including that originally (I have updated)

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked:
HorizonZz:

Pose2d(Translation2d(X: 2.03, Y: 0.05), Rotation2d(Rads: 0.05, Deg: 2.64))

Im not a javascript expert, but from what im reading it looks like that is just a string. You can do some string manipulation to get the rotation?
